name: Chocolate

pages.text: $(thing)Chocolate-making$() takes a few processing steps, for not much of a reward. It's important to remember, when playing Firmalife, that being a chocolatier is for your personal enjoyment and pleasure, rather than for trying to extract maximum value from any given input.

To start chocolate processing, cocoa beans must first be $(thing)roasted$() in an $(l:firmalife/ovens)Oven$() to make $(thing)Roasted Cocoa Beans$(). Then, craft the roasted beans with a $(thing)Knife$() to split the beans into $(thing)Cocoa Powder$() and $(thing)Cocoa Powder$().

The $(l:firmalife/mixing_bowl)Mixing Bowl$() is used to mix cocoa powder, butter, and sweetener (sugar or honey) to make $(thing)Chocolate Blends$(). The ratio of cocoa butter to powder determines what comes out:$(br)$(li)1 Powder, 1 Butter, 1 Sweetener: Milk Chocolate$()$(li)2 Powder, 1 Sweetener: Dark Chocolate$()$(li)2 Butter, 1 Sweetener: White Chocolate$()
Finally, chocolate is dried on a $(l:firmalife/drying)Drying Mat$() to make $(thing)Chocolate$().
